did.abstract: Student at University of Michigan. Leaflets, flyers, newsletters, and campaign materials concerning Campus Action, the mayoral campaign of Robert J. Harris in 1969, Interfaith Council for Peace, Eugene McCarthy's presidential campaign in 1968, Mobilization, Resistance, Socialist Labor Party, Student Peace Union, Students for a Democratic Society, Vietnam Summer, Young Americans for Freedom and Young Socialist Alliance.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of Richard G. Wilson (donor no. 4677)

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Richard G. Wilson papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Richard G. Wilson was a student at the University of Michigan in the mid to late 1960s. While at the University, he collected a variety of materials relating to the political events then taking place on the campus.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of leaflets, flyers, newsletters, and campaign materials concerning such organizations and events as Campus Action, the mayoral campaign of Robert J. Harris in 1969, Interfaith Council for Peace, Eugene McCarthy's presidential campaign in 1968, Mobilization, Resistance, Socialist Labor Party, Student Peace Union, Students for a Democratic Society, Vietnam Summer, Young Americans for Freedom and Young Socialist Alliance.
